tweet: The "Big 5" - $AAPL, $MSFT, $AMZN, $GOOGL, $FB - are at new price highs, but collectively their weight in the S&P is making a lower-high... modest, but worth noting.

While AMZN clings to the key $1600 level, BABA continues to quietly turn up and outperform. Check the bottom panel of this chart, BABA > AMZN.

A little misleading. The Dow is a price weighted Index. This is not abnormal in anyway. In fact, the equally-weighted S&P is handily outperforming the traditional cap-weighted S&P... the “average stock” is acting better than the Index. That’s the real story here.
